We can't minimize just how serious the attack on our democratic system was.

We can't "whatabout" or turn a blind eye to the fact that a sitting President encouraged a violent attack on another branch of government because he lost an election.

https://t.co/N9PkIohNT4
Democracy is worth standing up for.

I‚Äôm proud of everyone who showed up in Naperville today, despite the cold, to mark the one year anniversary of the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

Protecting our democracy requires each of us doing our part and taking a stand against political violence. https://t.co/swRLVurNtq

So, later that evening, we returned to the very Chamber that was desecrated hours earlier in the name of Trump‚Äôs falsehoods.
 
We completed our constitutional duty, and sent a clear message to all: American democracy would not succumb to the angry mob bent on ending it.

I shared the resolve of so many of my fellow Members who knew how important it was - not just for the American people to see, but for the entire world that was watching - that we get back to the business of certifying the election as quickly as possible.
Despite this incredible dereliction of leadership and the best attempts of the Trump mob, our democratic system endured.

We should also never forget that while innocent people feared for their lives in the Capitol, President Trump was watching gleefully from the White House dining room - apparently pleased with how his incitement was unfolding.

We‚Äôll always remember the videos and pictures from that day - not just of lawmakers being hurried away to safety by Capitol Police - but of staffers huddled under desks or barricading themselves behind doors to avoid the violent mob.
On January 6, 2021, a violent mob, instigated by a sitting President who refused to accept the reality of his defeat, forever stained that great tradition.
The Congressional certification of a fair and free presidential election has been a hallmark of our democratic system from the very beginning.
We the People, endured.
The violent mob failed. Democracy endured. https://t.co/8fMqZAiuFQ
